sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>leader</radical> is wearing a <radical>lid</radical> and is standing outside in <radical>winter</radical>. Plus it's raining and she's covered in <radical>drop</radical>s of water. On top of all this, it's <kanji>night</kanji>.
meaningInfo: If it helps, you can come up with a reason why she's outside in the winter at night. Also, why is she wearing a lid on her head? Probably because she's protecting her people from something that comes at night.
readingMnemonic: Question is, what is she protecting them from during the <kanji>night</kanji>? Turns out, it's the <reading>Ya</reading>nkees (<ja>や</ja>) baseball team. They're out for blood, and only the leader can protect us.
readingInfo: Imagine the Yankees stomping towards the leader, baseball bats in hand, blood on their faces. They're here to eat, and nobody will stop them. Feel the fear of their approach. Will you survive another night with them on the prowl?
